title: Oxford
name: Taylorian Institute
alt: also known as the Taylor Institution
directions: corner of St Giles' and Beaumont St, opposite the Randolph Hotel
content: The University's centre for the study of modern European languages and literature, established in 1845. Its library contains the largest specialist collection in its field in Britain. It is in a neo-classical building designed by Charles R. Cockerell and erected between 1841 and 1844 by the University to house the Institution and the Randolph Galleries (now the [http://www.ashmolean.org/ Ashmolean Museum]).
